image.altText: A photo showing a man wearing glasses and wearing a black baseball cap, ookingdirectly at the camera

props.synopsis: The NT's new CLP government has promised to curb soaring crime with tougher laws and enforcement. But the manager of an Alice Springs shopping centre has found pulling back on security, instead of increasing it, has worked better.

title.children: The new NT government plans to toughen crime laws, but this shopping centre is suggesting an alternative

image.altText: Police tape across a road on a suburban street, with a police officer and police car in the background.

props.synopsis: Peter Gardiner, one of two brothers convicted of murdering 20-year-old Dillon Willis in 2021, has been given the mandatory sentence of life in prison.

title.children: Youngest of two brothers convicted of murdering man in Karama sentenced to life in prison

image.altText: A composite image of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton.

props.synopsis: The US and UK elections this year are proving to be significant flex points, and that has consequences for us in Australia. But it also shows how clear values are the only workable response to chaos.

title.children: Australia is labouring through wrenching transitions, and there's only one way out of the chaos

image.altText: A blurred photo of a dog.

props.synopsis: Despite Instagram's policies against explicit content, the ABC has uncovered dozens of accounts on the platform — each with hundreds of followers — sharing images and videos of dogs being sexually exploited as well as other types of animal cruelty.

title.children: Instagram awash with easily accessible, 'horrific' accounts depicting animal cruelty

image.altText: Stack of several thousand dollars worth of Australian $50 notes showing David Unaipon

props.synopsis: New analysis released by the super industry has found one in four workers is missing out on compulsory superannuation payments, with women and those in lower-paid jobs worst hit.

title.children: 'Leaves people poorer when they retire': Could you be missing out on super payments?

image.altText: Trump christians pic

props.synopsis: A revised indictment is filed against former US president Donald Trump in the case involving alleged interference of the 2020 US election.

title.children: Donald Trump faces revised US indictment in election subversion case

image.altText: A man named Clifford Sunfly stands in front of a Toyota four-wheel drive.

props.synopsis: With drug abuse, rampant and widespread unemployment, the challenge to get people into work in Balgo, one of Australia's most remote communities, is enormous. But there are signs the winds of change are blowing in WA's far north.

title.children: The enormous mission to get residents employed in one of Australia's most remote communities

image.altText: Four remote voting stations next to each other.

props.synopsis: Nearly two-thirds of enrolled voters in some remote Northern Territory electorates didn't vote in the 2024 election. We asked Indigenous Territorians why voter turnout was so poor.

title.children: Hurt after failed Voice referendum linked to low remote voter turnout in NT election

image.altText: A woman holds her child with a demolished home in the background

props.synopsis: As many as 700,000 people are expected to attended an outdoor mass with Pope Francis next month in Dili, so authorities are bulldozing the homes of about 200 of the city's poorest residents to make room.

title.children: Hundreds of homes in Dili's poorest areas bulldozed to make room for mass with Pope Francis

image.altText: About a dozen student are seen talking in a courtyard, in front of a tall sandstone clock tower at the University of Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The federal government's plan to cap international student numbers has split the tertiary education sector, drawing uproar from prestigious urban universities but cautious optimism from their regional and suburban competitors.

title.children: International student cap draws fury from top universities

image.altText: Catherine King

props.synopsis: Federal Infrastructure Minister Catherine King faces a worsening revolt from the nation's most populous states over plans to slash the Commonwealth's share of funding for national road and railway projects.

title.children: NSW and Victoria challenge federal government's 50:50 road and rail funding deal

image.altText: two men hugging, while one carries his daughter on his hip

props.synopsis: The NT polls have closed and the results show a resounding victory for the Country Liberal Party, but there's also been some interesting swings to the Greens and independents. Here's how each electorate voted.

title.children: Breaking down the NT election outcome: How the results fell in every seat across the territory

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair and wearing glasses looking at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: What was meant to be a dream holiday in Japan for Cassandra Nichterlein and her young family turned into a costly nightmare when their return flight from Japan was cancelled.

title.children: A family was left $7,000 out of pocket after a flight cancellation. Jetstar initially offered them $600

image.altText: Charlot Salwai stands at a podium holding a piece of paper and speaking into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Vanuatu's prime minister and a senior regional diplomat warn Australia and New Zealand not to use a high-profile new policing initiative to box out strategic competitors from the region.

title.children: Vanuatu and Melanesia warn 'cryptic' Pacific Policing Initiative could lock China out of region

image.altText: A woman stands in front of media microphones with the Australian, NT and Aboriginal flags behind her.

props.synopsis: Less than 48 hours since the Country Liberal Party's landslide election victory in the Northern Territory, the incoming chief minister has revealed her government's first actions to overturn crime and "restore community safety".

title.children: 'The important work has begun': NT chief minister-elect outlines new government's first steps

image.altText: A man with short white hair is talking off-camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The Country Liberal Party ran hard on issues that were affecting everyday Territorians, with a huge focus on community safety. Territory Labor, on the other hand, was completely out of touch.

title.children: A tale of two campaigns – how the CLP stormed the suburbs to win an NT election landslide

image.altText: A soldier and a civilian man having a conversation

props.synopsis: The IDF says it rescued Arab Bedouin citizen of Israel Qaid Farhan Alkadi, 52, "in a complex operation in the southern Gaza Strip".

title.children: Israel rescues 52-year-old hostage taken in October 7 terror attack

image.altText: Business people walk past a shiny black sign that reads "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: Rate cuts by the US Federal Reserve and other central banks will create a near-irresistible pressure for Australia's Reserve Bank to follow, potentially very soon.

title.children: Interest rate cuts in the US should mean cuts in Australia too — perhaps quickly

image.altText: Boeing starliner

props.synopsis: With NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore stranded aboard the ISS for months, a decorated former astronaut tells the ABC they would know and have trained for the risks but the view is definitely worth it.

title.children: NASA's astronauts now aboard the ISS face 'untold consequences' for their future

image.altText: two men in suits

props.synopsis: The new president says there needs to be a "conversation" about the number of jobs police are called out to, as domestic violence rates and attrition within the force soar.

title.children: 'Our police are at breaking point': New Queensland Police Union president says other agencies need to 'do their job'

image.altText: Protesters shouting and speaking into megaphone at a CFMEU rally in Sydney's CBD

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of tradies across the country have marched in protest against the federal government's decision to put the construction arm of the CFMEU under administration.

title.children: PM warns of 'consequences' as thousands of CFMEU workers march across Australia

image.altText: Michael Voss holds his phone up as two people scramble out of a Mercedes Benz crashed sideways in a residential street.

props.synopsis: Michael Voss conducted a citizen's arrest when he pinned a 16-year-old to the ground and waited for police. What is a citizen's arrest and would you do it?

title.children: What are the risks of a citizen's arrest like the one AFL coach Michael Voss made?

image.altText: Chappell Roan performs onstage during Lollapalooza at Grant Park on August 01, 2024 in Chicago, Illinois.

props.synopsis: With pop superstar Chappell Roan speaking out repeatedly against "creepy" behaviour from fans, we unpack what celebrities do and don't owe their audiences.

title.children: Chappell Roan wants fans to back off. Do celebrities owe us anything?

image.altText: fed uni student frank dyer inside the ballarat foodbank centre picking up a can

props.synopsis: Replicating a mini supermarket, shelves are brimming with groceries from local and international big-name brands, giving dozens of vulnerable students participating in the trial, the power of choice at no cost.

title.children: Free 'supermarket' for vulnerable uni students 'a blessing', participant says

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy speaks into a microphone with one arm raised, in front of a blue background.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has defended Kyiv's surprise incursion into Russia's Kursk region after Russian officials decried the move as "playing with fire".

title.children: Zelenskyy defends surprise Kursk incursion after Russian official decries 'playing with fire'

image.altText: The side view of the back of a restaurant backing onto a public park. Two people are seen walking in the distance.

props.synopsis: The Comedor restaurant backs onto the historic Camperdown Memorial Rest Park in Sydney's inner west and has been granted a permit to use 30 square metres of public land to build a deck with outdoor furniture. The decision has blindsided both local residents and councillors.

title.children: Restaurant's plans to build outdoor dining area in popular Sydney park halted after backlash

image.altText: A man stands in a suit speaking.

props.synopsis: Transcripts obtained by the ABC show a soccer-loving businessman behind LNP election donations told a court he helped introduce Queensland's opposition leader to run a training company that later collapsed.

title.children: Entrepreneur behind LNP donations backed David Crisafulli to head training company, court documents reveal

image.altText: Gemma Houghton holds a footy while leaning on a railing in the stands looking away

props.synopsis: Two-time All Australian Gemma Houghton says her passion for football ran dry after her mate's death, as a study has found female athletes face more psychosocial stressors including exposure to sexual harassment and challenges around parenting.

title.children: AFLW star says losing her best friend to suicide left her struggling on field

image.altText: A woman with shoulder length blonde hair in an orange sweater holds a mug that reads "straight outta Tuggers".

props.synopsis: Tuggeranong was once "nappy valley", but growth in Canberra has now shifted to the north and west, and this area is not predicted to expand.

title.children: This area is set to have zero per cent population growth. What does that mean for its residents?

image.altText: A woman blows her nose with a box of tissues in front of her

props.synopsis: Free flu vaccine has been available to Queenslanders for the past two years but the state’s influenza cases are more than double the five-yearly average — doctors say better marketing could have flipped the script.

title.children: Free flu vaccination program cost $47m without improving Queensland's vaccine take-up

image.altText: A close-up of a customer pumping fuel into a car at a service station.

props.synopsis: Escalating geopolitical tensions threaten to send the price of oil soaring and it could mean bad news for Australians at the petrol pump.

title.children: Escalating geopolitical tensions threaten to send petrol prices soaring

image.altText: A head and shoulders shot of a man with short hair looking downwards while walking outside.

props.synopsis: A sex predator who pretended to be a teenage YouTube star to blackmail hundreds of children into performing sexual acts is sentenced to 17 years in jail.

title.children: 'No comparable case': Man who posed as fake Youtube star to lure children into performing sex acts jailed for 17 years

image.altText: A charred vehicle sits in a field of green grass.

props.synopsis: The most aggressive and dominant ethnic Baloch armed group has launched a highly organised series of attacks on police stations, railway lines and highways as part of its fight for independence and to push out Chinese-backed projects.

title.children: Who are the 'anarchy' seeking militants who launched Operation 'Dark Windy Storm' in Pakistan?

image.altText: SES boat in a flooded street in Maribyrnong.

props.synopsis: Government action is needed to stop flood victims worn out from fighting long battles with insurers from accepting unfair cash settlements for their damaged homes, the author of a new report says.

title.children: Calls to protect flood victims from low ball cash offers from insurers

image.altText: A woman wearing a blue burqa covering shields her eyes from the sun and camera while she walks in the street

props.synopsis: Virtue laws introduced by the Taliban ban women from speaking or showing their faces in public as a senior UN official called it an extension of the "already intolerable restrictions" on Afghan women.

title.children: 'Sound of a female voice' banned in public across Afghanistan as UN decries virtue laws
